subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Seed, Series A, B, C: The Funding Ladder
description: A quick win: understand Seed, Series A, B, C: The Funding Ladder.

hook.text: A startup raises a Seed round, then A, then B, then C. Each letter means more money and higher stakes.

buildup.text: Seed: prove the idea ($1-5M). Series A: prove growth ($5-20M). Series B: prove scale ($20-50M+).

discovery.text: Each round has different investors, milestones, and expectations. The bar rises sharply.

twist.text: Only 10% of seed-funded startups reach Series A. The funnel is brutally narrow.

climax.text: By Series C, you're either on a path to IPO or acquisition. There's no going back to small.

punchline.text: Each round buys time. What you do with that time decides the next round.

quiz.question: What milestone is typically expected at Series A?
options: Proof of growthâ€”demonstrating the business can scale beyond initial traction
